Comments_List: I learned more about the history of the Italian-American community in New York.
Furthered my knowledge on Italian American immigration history, developed my critical reading skills, engaged in thoughtful discussion on literature, and improved my Italian writing skills.
I learned a lot about what life was like as an immigrant coming to America through close reading of very famous Italian literature.
I learned so much about the Italian immigrant experience that I feel like is not often talked about in American history classes.

Strengths are the small class size - you got to know everyone in the class and everyone had a chance to speak during discussion.  Professor Mazzotta was great at encouraging our thoughts and helping guide our analysis.  The reading pace was slow which was really nice, though we could have gone a bit faster and had more structure to our discussions.  But overall, the class was great.
We read so many interesting novels and had so many insightful conversations regarding them. It would have been helpful to have more structure in terms of how the course was organized.
Good course. We also had a Skype conversation with Tina Fallani, an Italian film director who had contributed to making "The godfather."

I would definitely recommend this class!  The discussions are interesting and if you show up and make an effort, you will do well.  The workload is very light and it's enjoyable and interesting to chat with Professor Mazzotta.  As long as you are engaged, you will learn and get something out of it.
Great course. Professor Mazzotta is insightful, entertaining, and funny. Reading load was very manageable - interesting, engrossing books
Yes I would recommend this course to any student looking to read some good Italian literature and learn about the lives of immigrants.
